text: Draught at Akkurat, Stockholm, Sweden. Clear golden, large white head. Bready malt, herbal hops, and that particular elusive Gänstaller house aroma. Medium bodied, medium carbonation. Dry, medium bitterness. Excellent.

UPDATED: DEC 30, 2016 Draught at Akkurat, 11/28/16.Massive, massive amount of thick, incredibly well-retained, white head tops a lime-tinted, brass-gold body with a surprising amount of haze for a "filtered" product. Probably not filtered and probably the zwickel pils, but its listed as the pils on their board. Anyhow, not too important.The nose is full of strong floral notes; fresh and botanical, with black pepper and tons of well-attenuated honey. Light lavender, even. Nelson who tried it remarked it was too soapy in the nose and while I hear that a lot, I never really get it. Perhaps thats just a low perception of alkaloids for my palate? No idea. Anyways, I loved it and despite the haze, it seemed clean. No yeastiness or flaws.In the mouth its very carbonated, malty and rich but decidedly well-attenuated with strong minerality on the end (sourdough and copper!). Hugely floral, with zesty lemon and black pepper-like hop notes, as well. Bitterness is pleasing and perhaps a bit strong, making it a bit much for its sessionable strength, but its not resinous or sour and its certainly delightful when youre only having one glass of it.

Keg @ Akkurat. Hazy golden, firm and lasting white head, rich sticky lacing all around the glass. Floral and grassy aroma, bread and butterscotch. Soft and gentle carbonated, medium bodied, smooth and crisp mouthfeel. Floral bitter taste, pleasantly grassy, butterscotch and white bread. Very drinkable!

Draft at akkurat 
Clear, yellow, white head
Aroma of flower, honey, 
Taste flat, thin, lager feel. Slight bitter. Pors.

Draught at Akkurat. Pours golden with thick white head. Aroma has notes of herbs, honey, strawberries and flowers. Taste is really well balanced with notes of honey and herbs. Finish is excellent! My favorite beer!

Draught at Akkurat. Clear golden liquid with medium to big white head. Aroma of bread, light grain, earth, floral hops, Iight fatty malt and nuts. Taste is light sweet and light to medium bitter with notes of bred, light earth and noble hops. Light to medium bodied with medium to high carbonation. Excellent pils. Extremely drinkable.
Notevole al baso con note malate e floreali, di giusto corpo, in bocca é piena ed equilibrata con un finale gradevolmente luppolato. Ottima.
Aroma is bready malts, herbs, grass, diacetylic notes. Flavour is malts, herbs, grass. Really boring.
Lasting light beige head. Tiny clowdiness in a light golden beer. Almost no aroma just a hint of pils malts. Sparkling and malty taste with a medium bitterness. Big drinkabillity.

On tap @ Akkurat. Clear golden with a medium fully lasting white head and little lacing. Aroma is of cereals with a nice light sweetness, massive fresh grass presence and citrus notes. Taste is slightly sweet with fresh cereals and grass, light citrus and light bitterness. Light to medium body, but never thin. Pinpoint carbonation. Fluffy mouthfeel. Crisp and clean. Extremely tasty with a nice depth for the stye. Amazingly drinkable and quenching. Awesome Pils! It wasnt out of place along the great lambics with drank all night.

On tap at Akkurat. Clear blond pour with rich slab of frothy white head. Aroma is really perfumy, super floral, something like lavender, soft bready grainy notes, light dusty hop. Taste is as floral, lavender, light honey maltiness, soft bready malt, pretty malt forward for a pils, but clean while keeping a really nice level of complexity. Palate is light, with just right carbonation, light and fluffy. Really tasty.

Draught @ Taphouse, Lavendelstraede 15, DK-1462 Copenhagen, Denmark. [ As Gänstaller Bräu Pils ].Clear medium yellow color with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, off-white to white head. Aroma is moderate malty, hay, straw, pale malt, moderate hoppy, grass. Flavour is moderate sweet and bitter with a average to long duration, grass, grain, pale malt. Body is medium, texture is oily to watery, carbonation is soft. [20140521]
Very floral aroma. Malty sweet fruity taste. Very dry good bitterness floral finish.
Draught (Akkurat, Stockholm) - Golden with a white head. Grain, citrus and hay in the aroma. Lemon, lime, grain and straw feature in the nicely balanced and refreshing taste. Very nice.
From tap. Pours clear and golden yellow with a small white head. Mild fruity, toasted malty. Smooth malty, toasted and light butterish. Bitter, grassy and light citrusy. Bitter and toasted finish.

Draught at Taphouse.
Clear yellow colored with a medium sized white head.
Malty aroma of hay, hops and citrus.
Malty flavor of hay, hops and licorice with notes of cardboard.
Hoppy finish.
Draft. A golden beer with a lazing white head. The aroma has notes of malt and fresh grass. The flavor is sweet with notes of malt, straw, and lemons, leading to a bitter finish.
Rated from backlog. Pours golden with a white head. Mango and grain notes in the aroma. Taste is flowery and citrusy with a small crispiness. Very well made.

17/10/2013 Ma che siete venuti a fà (tap). Dorata, limpida, schiuma bianca molto abbondante e persistente. Al naso sentori di malto, pane, luppolo, note erbacee leggere, un po sporco. In bocca ha un attacco dolciastro di malto e un finale secco e luppolato. Corpo leggero, carbonazione elevata. Pils molto buona, anche se forse mi aspettavo qualcosina di più.
On tap. Yellow with lasting white head. Aroma of pale malt, grain and grassy hops. Taste is dominated by grain with some malt and grass. Well balanced but a bit too grainy for my tongue

Draft in Strassgiech.

Head is mostly lasting.
Body is clear medium yellow.

Aroma is moderately malty (toasted bread), moderately to heavily hoppy (honeysuckle flowers, herbs).

Flavor is moderately sweet, lightly bitter.
Finish is lightly sweet, lightly to moderately bitter.

Medium body, silky texture, soft carbonation.

As with most of Andys works of art, there is no way to adequately describe this in words. Along with Ocator, Kellerbier, and Smoked Zoigl, these things literally -- *literally* -- bring tears to my eyes. I cannot say that about any other brewer in the world. Andreas Gaenstaller has no peers. Period.  Best pilsner on Earth?  With 99.9% certainty.

Draught @ Akkurat, Stockholm<br)

Pours clear golden with a thick white head. Aroma of grassy hops, crisp malts and some buttery hay notes. Taste is clean, dry and crisp with notes of grassy hops, bready malts and hay. Finish is bready, crisp and hoppy with hints of butter and hay. Well balanced, clean and tasty pils.

UPDATED: AUG 30, 2015 Simply put: the cleanest, purest and most vibrant expression of pilsner malt  and spalt and hallertauer hops that exists in the world.  Nobody else even comes close.  Andys work is on an entirely different level!   

Minerallic calcium carbonate excitement.
Juicy floral lemon hop aroma.
Pure ecstasy of pilsner malt: warm, aromatic baked cracker richness.
Unbelievably clean.
Smacking, quenching acidity, perfectly matched for body, carbonation and sweetness.

Unequivocal perfection in beer, a work of art and a masterpiece, made by the best brewer in the world.  Literally flawless. Malt is unbelievably soft, carbonation and serving temperature spot on, and the texture is what KILLS... malt has never been expressed with such richness, and hops with such authenticity. Even at room temperature it still exudes perfection.  I had previously given this beer a 3.5 at Akkurat, and it is a fragile beer that doesnt travel well.  But here is a keg brought by Andy from the brewery to the Zoiglstube for our visit, and what he puts in front of us is one of the most beautiful presentations of beer in the world. So now its a 5.0.  For anyone who loves lagers made without compromise, they owe themselves a visit to Franconia to track down Andys super lagers: Kellerbier, Zoigl, Smoked Zoigl, his rich and malty dunkles lagers, and his strong bocks, both traditional and experimental. This is something special, a filter version of Zwickelpils that was originally server only at Akkurat, and its incredble that in Oberfranken, the land of world-class unfiltered lagers, this filtered Pilsner may be the pinnacle of brewery quality.  Its the only beer that Andy filters, and doing so allows the Pilsner malt and German noble hops to shine like they never have before. 
Words can not do it justice. This beer transcends life. There is beauty here that Ive never seen before in beer.
On tap at Drei Kronen Strassgiech.  Hazy pale gold thick white head.  Oh yes, fresh flowery hop, very good.  Yes very drinkable light hoppy easy drinking, just amazing these beers.

(Draught at Akkurat, Stockholm, 7 March 2013) Yellow colour with lasting, white head. Malty nose with white bread, cereal and grass. Malty taste with notes of bread, cereal, toffee, a touch of honey and a generous grassy bitterness in the finish. Medium body, with a slight malt sweetness. Tasty and well balanced pilsener. Nice one.

Wasnt so impressed with this one.  Pours crystal clear golden yellow with a thick white head.  Nose is grassy, corn syrup.  Not much  else.  Taste is sweet with very little detectable bitter.  The mouthfeel is crisp and clean, the body is light and the finish is long.
Draught at Akkurat:Clear golden with a creamy head. Aroma is butter and hops. Sharp carbonation. Flavour is herbal hops with some butter and vegetables.
Draught @ Akkurat. Golden colour with a small white head. Aroma of malt, hops. Flavour is malt, hops, bread.
On tap at Bishops Arms in Örebro. It poured a clear pale yellow liquid. A crisp and fresh lager. Well brewed and refreshing.

Sample at SBWF 2012.

Golden with a medium white head. Grass, malt, bread and some butter. Refreshing and a nicely drinkable beer this one.

Draught at BA Folkungagatan
Hazy golden with a white head. 
Pretty light aroma with sple butterscotch. 
Smooth and fresh palate. 
Some cereal notes. Crisp bitterness.

Draught at Jerntorgets Brygghus, Gothenburg. Pale golden clear beer with an offwhite lacy head. Fruity, hoppy fresh aroma and simliar flavour with some nice sweetness. A nice refreshing summerbeer :-)

Draught at Jerntorgets Brygghus on July 21, 2012Hazy honey color, nice fluffy white head. Floral, malty, viola, sweet scent. Malty, herbal, cream taste, grainy. Medium to spritzy mouthfeel, medium bitterness.

(Bottle) Pours pale golden with a creamy white head. The aroma grassy, herbal, spicy and light earthy hops alongside bready, hay-ish and cracker-like malt. Hints of dew and wood. The flavour is light sweet and light to medium bitter grass, mild herbs, bread and hay. The mouthfeel is soft with a light to medium carbonation. Fancy and balanced, bitter finish. Light to medium bodied.

UPDATED: JUL 4, 2016 Draught @ The Rover. Pours tiny hazy golden with a creamy white head that is very slow to dissipate while clinging to the glass leaving lots of lacing. Smell is sweet and malty with sweet white bread, grass, butter scotch, dried flowers, persimmon, plums and hints of caramel. Taste is sweet, bitter and malty with sweet bread, hay, green grapes, butterscotch, plums, sugar and persimmon. Mouthfeel is round, slightly sticky sweet and medium bodied, finish is sweet and slightly bitter with sweet bread, grass and fudge. Nice but a bit lacking in the nose.Re-rate. Draught @ Rover among other places. A great tasting pilsner. Has all you could wish for in a refreshing and tasty beer. And the sight of the head blows you away.Another re-rate! Serveral glasses @ Akkurat. Delicious pilsener. Just the right balances between the white bread cracker malts and bitter bite floral hops. Always fresh! Always delicious!

Golden colour with a small white head. Aroma is bready malts, herbs, grass, saltwater and some mild diacetylic notes. Flavour is bready malts, herbs, grass, mild salty and earthy notes. Smooth, but a bit boring.
Draught at Akkurat, Stockholm. Golden beer, nice lasting white head. Hoppy metallic aroma thatcturns into à bready malt profile. Malty flavor, bready, hoppy with metal notes. Clean and fresh pilsner.

Draught at Akkurat, Stockholm.  Clear golden, firm head. Grassy hops smoothly give way for doughy, slightly buttery malt. Medium bodied with firm, well rounded mouthfeel. Long, distinct salty bitterness. Solid, meaty, well made pilsener.

UPDATED: SEP 13, 2016 Draught at akkurat, BA Folkis and Man in the Moon.
Pours hazy golden  with a white head.
Lovely thirstquenching, smooth  and balanced brew. A favourite!
UPDATED: SEP 13, 2016 Draught @ Akkurat. Pours golden with a white head. Mango and grain notes in the aroma. Taste is flowery and citrusy with a small crispiness. True to the syle. Well made.
